alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 04 at 4:26PM AKST until December 05 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM AKST TUESDAY FOR THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Visibility reduced to as low as one half mile at times. Northeast winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 6 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow affecting Thompson Pass tonight will lead to periods of low visibility due to blowing snow. Snow will taper off Tuesday morning, while winds continue. Blowing snow may continue to significantly reduce visibility to one half mile at times. Another round of heavier snow and gusty winds beginning Tuesday afternoon may bring the potential for blizzard conditions through Thompson Pass.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
